title: Rotational kinematics - stopping times and angles

content.description: A disk is initially at rest. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the disk starts to spin about an axis through its center. The disk spins with a constant angular acceleration, and after <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn></math> second the disk has an angular displacement of <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn></math> radian.
content.question: Now the disk is given an initial angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. This time, the disk decelerates with a constant angular acceleration <math alttext="negative alpha sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math>. The disk rotates through an angle <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math> in a time <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math> before coming to a stop. Which of the following is true for a disk with an initial angular velocity <math alttext="2 omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and constant angular acceleration <math alttext="negative 2 alpha sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math> ?

choices.label: The disk stops in a time greater than <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>.
The disk stops in a time less than <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>.
The disk rotates through an angle greater than <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math> before stopping.
The disk rotates through an angle less than <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math> before stopping.

content.answer: The disk rotates through an angle greater than <math alttext="delta theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>θ</mi></math> before stopping.
